body: @Xydez It would not be difficult to add. May I ask why you need this?

To dynamically append things onto the title (such as adding a dot every time an action is performed for example.). It isn't really *required* but it's useful since the user of the API doesn't have to keep track of the title themselves.
Thanks. Will consider this for 3.4. Thought there was an earlier issue for this but can't find it now.

I must second this feature request because I know my OS (Debian with KDE) adds `<2>`, `<3>`... to end of the title to have unique window titles.

Tested on [`kate`](https://kate-editor.org/) for screenshot.
Works same on other applications.

issue.body:
This PR implements the feature requested by issue #1448, partially based on the implementation by #1909.

A design choice has been made to return the same title which was set, rather than the title which could be obtained from the platform. This reduces surface area of the code and is easier to reason about when making dynamic titles.
